title: The Nunu buffs were not even funny.
body:
540-590 HP for a champion with a sub-40% winrate, when HP wasn't even his problem and other non-tank champions still have higher hp. 50 HP is less than 150 gold worth of HP. If you actually thought this would help him out at all, you're totally delusional. 


When a champion has a <40% winrate, that's the time to be heavy-handed with buffs. Nunu hates everything about this season. The runes, the item changes, everything.


With him being so abysmally useless, now is the time to experiment with his kit. Add additional affects to his abilities and make him more supportive like Ivern.

More explicitly, once you have the non enchanted jg item, sustain is sufficient for a trip long enough to plant wards, farm, take a neutral and maybe gank.

Is Lolalytics another site that only takes data from Plat+ games? Because that's not a good determinant of player behavior. It's better for determining balance, but it ignores 80% of the population outright, so you can't say that 26% of Nunu games involve Guardian if you ignore all the players who play him at low elo.

I agree with you. I never said that Nunu needed any work on Riot's part. That has not been a part of my discussion on this thread at all. You asked why people aren't taking Guardian on him. I told you. Nunu is not a Warden. He does not spend time near his allies. The area of effect for proccing Guardian is ridiculously small unless you use your buff on them. Even if you do use your buff on them, it gives you a very small shield, and Nunu is the tank that already has a larger health pool than most. Guardian is a lot better on champions with MR and armor steroids because they tend to have less health. Nunu has tons of it, he doesn't need more. 

If Nunu could use Aftershock, Aftershock would be way better on him than Guardian. 

A lot of Guardian's power is invisible to the Nunu player. It involves shielding an ally, which is not something you're paying attention to while you're brawling on the front lines. That power is much more appreciative to a support player who is constantly watching the ally's health bar. 

Notice that most of this (except for the irrelevant health stacking on a champion who easily gets 5k+ health each game) has nothing to do with the POWER of the keystone. His win rate is all about the power of the keystone, the keystone selection rate has everything to do with the satisfaction the player gets out of the keystone. People who aren't choosing to support don't generally give a shit about supporting other players. I know I don't. I've said it before and I'll say it again: fuck my teammates. I play Nunu to ruin the enemy jungler's life, not to support anyone.

Also, Blood Boil has an odd interaction with Guardian because when you cast it on Nunu it seeks and targets the nearest ally champion to use it on automatically. That means you can waste your Guardian keystone without meaning to by just using an ability on yourself when you're too close to the mage who doesn't go in with you. Then you get the shield, the mage doesn't, and the keystone only provides half the power it is intended to. So it's not even that interactive or useful with the ability Nunu can use it with. 

And even after all of that, I am still not arguing for Nunu to get buffed. He needs a full rework, which should include giving him a hard crowd control ability because Riot seems convinced that you MUST be able to immobilize enemy champions if you are to be considered a "tank". Courage of the Colossus and Aftershock prove this.

Where do you get the idea that Nunu hates everything about this season? Maybe you're the delusional one. Guardian is one of the best things to ever happen to Nunu, the synergy with his W is insane. I've had situations where this rune has saved somebody's life just because I could press w on them in time and block that 1 tick of damage. Old Nunu wouldn't have been able to do that. You argue that he's useless? Maybe you're just playing him wrong, he seems pretty useful in my games. He can secure dragon safely very early on into the game, he has one of the best counter jungles in the game, and once he hits six, the enemy bot lane is as good as dead. Nunu is by far my favorite champion in the game, and the moment that riot starts trying to 'experiment with his kit' and 'add additional effects and abilities' is the moment I shed tears of sorrow. 

Basically, I don't agree with your argument because in my experience he doesn't suffer from anything you point out here. Sure, the buff was virtually pointless, but you're assuming he needed one in the first place. Also, when you start saying stuff like 'make him more like X champion', take into consideration that every champion in the game should have their own unique play style that doesn't really feel like another champion's. If riot decided to add 'additional effects' to Nunu to make him play more like Ivern, then why would I want to play Nunu in the first place? Why wouldn't I just go play Ivern himself rather than his mediocre doppelgänger? For the most part, riot has done a good job of maintaining originality and individuality throughout their roster, and I hope it stays that way.
